Example

Now use the separation of variables method, putting \(u(x,y)=X(x)Y(y)\), to find the differential equations satisfied by \(X(x)\), \(Y(y)\) and decide on the sign of the separation constant \(K\):

Solution

We have boundary conditions which, like the worked example above, are periodic in \(x\). Hence the differential equations are, again,

\(\qquad X''=-\lambda^2 X\) \(Y''=+\lambda^2\)
putting the separation constant \(K\) as \(-\lambda^2\).
